live ticker : togo 0:2 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 05.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 23.06.2006 live ticker : togo 0:2 france review all the highlights from the game with the dw-world.de live ticker . group g final games dw-world.de will follow already out togo against a france who will have to take their last chance to show they are still a team to count on and not just a set of individual quality .
the french must win to go through while switzerland and south-korea could reach the last sixteen with a draw , although it 's unlikely any of the teams will want to risk playing for such a result .
the line-ups .
togo -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 16-kossi agassa ; 2-dare nibombe , 3-jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , 5-massamesso tchangai ; 13-richmond forson , 7-moustapha salifou , 18-yao junior senaya , 10-cherif toure mamam , 6-yao aziawanou ; 4-emmanuel adebayor , 17-mohamed kader coubadja .
coach : otto pfister france -lrb- 4-4-2 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 13-mikael silvestre ; 22-franck ribery , 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele , 7-florent malouda ; 20-david trezeguet , 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- france coach raymond domenech , missing playmaker zinedine zidane and defender eric abidal through suspension , paired david trezeguet with thierry henry in attack for a game the french must win by two clear goals to make sure of reaching the last 16 of the world cup .
there is no genuine playmaker to replace zidane in a four-man midfield on the right side of which exciting newcomer franck ribery will start a match for france for the second time .
mikael silvestre comes in for abidal at left back while central defender lilian thuram wins his 117th cap , breaking the national record he shared with marcel desailly .
togo coach otto pfister , who had promised to gave all of his players a chance to take the field , made four changes to his starting line-up bringing in jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , yao aziawanou , moustapha salifou and yao junior senaya , in place of thomas dossevi , kuami agboh , alaixys romao and toure assimiou .
the players are in the tunnel .
the teams take the pitch .
the crowd roars a welcome that quickly changes into peace as the anthems begin .
a long strip of yellow togo fans run along the side of the field but the blue fans of france are in majority under the roof in cologne .
1. min .
the french kick-off .
1. min .
the french will certainly try to get an early goal .
they start off in a good tempo and sagnol gets the first cross .
3. min .
the french are high up .
first chance is trzeguet 's .
the striker gets the ball just inside the box and turns to shoot .
his ball goes a meter wide .
5. min .
the french will have to watch out though .
it is never easy to play a team who has nothing to lose .
6. min .
trzeguet again .
ribery hits in the cross from the left and trezeguet heads it hard .
agassa gets a hand on it and tips it over the bar .
8. min .
a fast counter attack by togo gives barthez in the french goal a first opportunity to show himself .
10. min .
the game is leveling out .
the first minutes of french dominance have given way to a more even game .
11. min .
a long cross from the right ends up only a meter away from barthez who saves the following shot standing on his knees .
13. min .
trezeguet 's goal is offside .
the french striker gets the ball from ribery inside the box and scores before realizing he 's offside .
17. min .
the french have had a couple of good chances to score but so far it 's goalless .
the togolese are dangerous though when they get a chance to counter , something they do at high speed .
19. min .
the togolese have had it fairly easy to break the french attack , which gives the africans possibilities to counter over and over again .
21. min .
trezeguet again .
ribery has started the match well and hits another opener for trezeguet who should have finished better .
the ball is no problem for agassa .
22. min .
silvestre tries agassa with a half volley .
the pressure is there , the chances too but no goal .
25. min .
mamam tries a cross towards the middle but there are no togolese there .
27. min .
salifou comes in from the left and fires a shot that barthez ca n't hold at first .
the french goalie jumps forward to pull the ball back in .
27. min .
ribery brings the ball down the togolese field and gets a great chance to score .
his shot flies high over the goal though .
28. min .
makelele gets booked .
29. min .
mamam 's free-kick outside the french box is too high .
31. min .
a ball from ribery sails in to the box and is headed over the end line by nibombe just before trezeguet gets a chance to put his head on the ball .
35. min .
trezeguet gets a ball to run for but again the french striker is caught offside .
this time it 's very close .
37. min .
aziawonou sees yellow .
38. min .
the french keep coming in strong attacking waves but the togolese have so far always found a way to surf their way out of trouble .
39. min .
henry fires a rocket from thirty meters .
agassa can not hold it .
trezeguet takes the rebound from five meters but the togolese keeper is there again .
40. min .
will the french go into a panic ?
a first false pass by the french is met with whistles .
the french crowd is merciless .
43. min .
mamam gets booked .
the togolese holds on to vieira in the mid circle .
45. min .
the togolese must be happy going into the break with a 0-0 .
45 + 1. min .
a lovely cross from malouda is headed out by nibombe who 's perfectly placed in front of trezeguet and henry both waiting to score .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the french have piled up chances but no goal .
the togolese will have a tough second half but are also pretty cool in defense and make use of their counters , which have given the africans a handful of decent chances .
as it stands , a 0-1 for the french will be enough to see them trough thanks to the swiss leading korea 1-0 .
question is if france will have the mental strength to deliver .
45. min .
second half is on .
45. min .
let 's see if ribery can keep up his good work .
the french midfielder has shown there is life after zidane .
47. min .
ribery wins a free-kick deep on the right outside the box .
47. min .
ribery hits it towards the box line where a waiting trezeguet fires away .
the ball rebounds on a togolese to a corner .
49. min .
adebayor is free with barthez after a lovely chip .
the togolese is wrongly caught offside .
50. min .
kader fights his way towards the french box and gets a shot that flies high .
52. min .
beautiful combination by the french .
henry goes into the box and heels the ball to malouda who drives a cross into the middle where ribery has a great possibility to score but he shoots it up to the stands .
54. min .
goal france ! ! !
vieria .
54. min .
ribery brings the ball in on the left side of the box and passes it along the grass to vieira in the middle who turns and shoots the ball into the right side of the goal .
57. min .
henry gets the next chance as a high cross ball reaches his foot just in front of the togolese goal .
the ball goes wide .
58. min .
mamam goes for olufade .
the togolese bring on a striker for a midfielder .
60. min .
goal !
france !
henry ! ! ! 60. min .
sagnol hits the cross to the box line where vieira heads it on to a free standing henry .
this time nothing can stop him from hitting home his 35th goal for france .
63. min .
the french know they are through with this result but it looks like they will try to score another to be sure .
65. min .
the togolese play much the same way as in first half , waiting for the break to counter attack .
in second half though it has n't resulted in much .
66. min .
sagnol hits a ball along the right wing for ribery who gets the cross in but it goes past all players in the togolese box .
67. min .
vieira finds time for a delicious slide rule pass that reaches trezeguet but agassa is first on the ball .
70. min .
the togolese pay a rare visit to the french box .
the africans have little to play for and it 's understandable that their motivation might not be the strongest .
71. min .
the french are cutting down on the tempo .
73. min .
wiltord goes on for malouda .
an offensive substitution by the french coach suggests he wants more .
74. min .
adebayor leaves for dossevi .
77. min .
ribery leaves the pitch for govou .
ribery can be pleased with his performance .
78. min .
vieira is down after an accidental slap in the face .
the frenchman might be fishing for time a bit as the crowd does the wave .
80. min .
vieira walks off for diarra .
vieira has been the most prolific of the french in the second half .
82. min .
govou wins a free-kick on the right .
the french are not in hurry .
83. min .
another french free-kick sees diarra down for a while before he stands up again .
85. min .
a long ball into the french box forces barthez to make a short rush to be first on the ball .
87. min .
salifou sees yellow .
the togolese is not happy about the decision .
89. min .
togo get a last chance to score but they are a bit too slow inside the box to get a finish on the french goal .
90 + 1. min .
the togolese break in the circle and get yet another chance but no , the finishing touch is not there .
45 + 2. min .
the match is over .
france have won .
the last group stage games of the 2006 world cup have been played and the result is switzerland on top of group g which means they play ukraine , wheras france , group runners up , will have to play spain - which could be one of the more interesting last sixteen games . dw staff -lrb- per -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

live ticker : togo 0:2 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 13.01.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 23.06.2006 live ticker : togo 0:2 france review all the highlights from the game with the dw-world.de live ticker . group g final games dw-world.de will follow already out togo against a france who will have to take their last chance to show they are still a team to count on and not just a set of individual quality .
the french must win to go through while switzerland and south-korea could reach the last sixteen with a draw , although it 's unlikely any of the teams will want to risk playing for such a result .
the line-ups .
togo -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 16-kossi agassa ; 2-dare nibombe , 3-jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , 5-massamesso tchangai ; 13-richmond forson , 7-moustapha salifou , 18-yao junior senaya , 10-cherif toure mamam , 6-yao aziawanou ; 4-emmanuel adebayor , 17-mohamed kader coubadja .
coach : otto pfister france -lrb- 4-4-2 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 13-mikael silvestre ; 22-franck ribery , 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele , 7-florent malouda ; 20-david trezeguet , 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- france coach raymond domenech , missing playmaker zinedine zidane and defender eric abidal through suspension , paired david trezeguet with thierry henry in attack for a game the french must win by two clear goals to make sure of reaching the last 16 of the world cup .
there is no genuine playmaker to replace zidane in a four-man midfield on the right side of which exciting newcomer franck ribery will start a match for france for the second time .
mikael silvestre comes in for abidal at left back while central defender lilian thuram wins his 117th cap , breaking the national record he shared with marcel desailly .
togo coach otto pfister , who had promised to gave all of his players a chance to take the field , made four changes to his starting line-up bringing in jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , yao aziawanou , moustapha salifou and yao junior senaya , in place of thomas dossevi , kuami agboh , alaixys romao and toure assimiou .
the players are in the tunnel .
the teams take the pitch .
the crowd roars a welcome that quickly changes into peace as the anthems begin .
a long strip of yellow togo fans run along the side of the field but the blue fans of france are in majority under the roof in cologne .
1. min .
the french kick-off .
1. min .
the french will certainly try to get an early goal .
they start off in a good tempo and sagnol gets the first cross .
3. min .
the french are high up .
first chance is trzeguet 's .
the striker gets the ball just inside the box and turns to shoot .
his ball goes a meter wide .
5. min .
the french will have to watch out though .
it is never easy to play a team who has nothing to lose .
6. min .
trzeguet again .
ribery hits in the cross from the left and trezeguet heads it hard .
agassa gets a hand on it and tips it over the bar .
8. min .
a fast counter attack by togo gives barthez in the french goal a first opportunity to show himself .
10. min .
the game is leveling out .
the first minutes of french dominance have given way to a more even game .
11. min .
a long cross from the right ends up only a meter away from barthez who saves the following shot standing on his knees .
13. min .
trezeguet 's goal is offside .
the french striker gets the ball from ribery inside the box and scores before realizing he 's offside .
17. min .
the french have had a couple of good chances to score but so far it 's goalless .
the togolese are dangerous though when they get a chance to counter , something they do at high speed .
19. min .
the togolese have had it fairly easy to break the french attack , which gives the africans possibilities to counter over and over again .
21. min .
trezeguet again .
ribery has started the match well and hits another opener for trezeguet who should have finished better .
the ball is no problem for agassa .
22. min .
silvestre tries agassa with a half volley .
the pressure is there , the chances too but no goal .
25. min .
mamam tries a cross towards the middle but there are no togolese there .
27. min .
salifou comes in from the left and fires a shot that barthez ca n't hold at first .
the french goalie jumps forward to pull the ball back in .
27. min .
ribery brings the ball down the togolese field and gets a great chance to score .
his shot flies high over the goal though .
28. min .
makelele gets booked .
29. min .
mamam 's free-kick outside the french box is too high .
31. min .
a ball from ribery sails in to the box and is headed over the end line by nibombe just before trezeguet gets a chance to put his head on the ball .
35. min .
trezeguet gets a ball to run for but again the french striker is caught offside .
this time it 's very close .
37. min .
aziawonou sees yellow .
38. min .
the french keep coming in strong attacking waves but the togolese have so far always found a way to surf their way out of trouble .
39. min .
henry fires a rocket from thirty meters .
agassa can not hold it .
trezeguet takes the rebound from five meters but the togolese keeper is there again .
40. min .
will the french go into a panic ?
a first false pass by the french is met with whistles .
the french crowd is merciless .
43. min .
mamam gets booked .
the togolese holds on to vieira in the mid circle .
45. min .
the togolese must be happy going into the break with a 0-0 .
45 + 1. min .
a lovely cross from malouda is headed out by nibombe who 's perfectly placed in front of trezeguet and henry both waiting to score .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the french have piled up chances but no goal .
the togolese will have a tough second half but are also pretty cool in defense and make use of their counters , which have given the africans a handful of decent chances .
as it stands , a 0-1 for the french will be enough to see them trough thanks to the swiss leading korea 1-0 .
question is if france will have the mental strength to deliver .
45. min .
second half is on .
45. min .
let 's see if ribery can keep up his good work .
the french midfielder has shown there is life after zidane .
47. min .
ribery wins a free-kick deep on the right outside the box .
47. min .
ribery hits it towards the box line where a waiting trezeguet fires away .
the ball rebounds on a togolese to a corner .
49. min .
adebayor is free with barthez after a lovely chip .
the togolese is wrongly caught offside .
50. min .
kader fights his way towards the french box and gets a shot that flies high .
52. min .
beautiful combination by the french .
henry goes into the box and heels the ball to malouda who drives a cross into the middle where ribery has a great possibility to score but he shoots it up to the stands .
54. min .
goal france ! ! !
vieria .
54. min .
ribery brings the ball in on the left side of the box and passes it along the grass to vieira in the middle who turns and shoots the ball into the right side of the goal .
57. min .
henry gets the next chance as a high cross ball reaches his foot just in front of the togolese goal .
the ball goes wide .
58. min .
mamam goes for olufade .
the togolese bring on a striker for a midfielder .
60. min .
goal !
france !
henry ! ! ! 60. min .
sagnol hits the cross to the box line where vieira heads it on to a free standing henry .
this time nothing can stop him from hitting home his 35th goal for france .
63. min .
the french know they are through with this result but it looks like they will try to score another to be sure .
65. min .
the togolese play much the same way as in first half , waiting for the break to counter attack .
in second half though it has n't resulted in much .
66. min .
sagnol hits a ball along the right wing for ribery who gets the cross in but it goes past all players in the togolese box .
67. min .
vieira finds time for a delicious slide rule pass that reaches trezeguet but agassa is first on the ball .
70. min .
the togolese pay a rare visit to the french box .
the africans have little to play for and it 's understandable that their motivation might not be the strongest .
71. min .
the french are cutting down on the tempo .
73. min .
wiltord goes on for malouda .
an offensive substitution by the french coach suggests he wants more .
74. min .
adebayor leaves for dossevi .
77. min .
ribery leaves the pitch for govou .
ribery can be pleased with his performance .
78. min .
vieira is down after an accidental slap in the face .
the frenchman might be fishing for time a bit as the crowd does the wave .
80. min .
vieira walks off for diarra .
vieira has been the most prolific of the french in the second half .
82. min .
govou wins a free-kick on the right .
the french are not in hurry .
83. min .
another french free-kick sees diarra down for a while before he stands up again .
85. min .
a long ball into the french box forces barthez to make a short rush to be first on the ball .
87. min .
salifou sees yellow .
the togolese is not happy about the decision .
89. min .
togo get a last chance to score but they are a bit too slow inside the box to get a finish on the french goal .
90 + 1. min .
the togolese break in the circle and get yet another chance but no , the finishing touch is not there .
45 + 2. min .
the match is over .
france have won .
the last group stage games of the 2006 world cup have been played and the result is switzerland on top of group g which means they play ukraine , wheras france , group runners up , will have to play spain - which could be one of the more interesting last sixteen games . dw staff -lrb- per -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 23.06.2006 live ticker : togo 0:2 france review all the highlights from the game with the dw-world.de live ticker . group g final games dw-world.de will follow already out togo against a france who will have to take their last chance to show they are still a team to count on and not just a set of individual quality .
the french must win to go through while switzerland and south-korea could reach the last sixteen with a draw , although it 's unlikely any of the teams will want to risk playing for such a result .

togo -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 16-kossi agassa ; 2-dare nibombe , 3-jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , 5-massamesso tchangai ; 13-richmond forson , 7-moustapha salifou , 18-yao junior senaya , 10-cherif toure mamam , 6-yao aziawanou ; 4-emmanuel adebayor , 17-mohamed kader coubadja .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 23.06.2006 live ticker : togo 0:2 france review all the highlights from the game with the dw-world.de live ticker . group g final games dw-world.de will follow already out togo against a france who will have to take their last chance to show they are still a team to count on and not just a set of individual quality .

togo -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 16-kossi agassa ; 2-dare nibombe , 3-jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , 5-massamesso tchangai ; 13-richmond forson , 7-moustapha salifou , 18-yao junior senaya , 10-cherif toure mamam , 6-yao aziawanou ; 4-emmanuel adebayor , 17-mohamed kader coubadja .
coach : otto pfister france -lrb- 4-4-2 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 13-mikael silvestre ; 22-franck ribery , 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele , 7-florent malouda ; 20-david trezeguet , 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- france coach raymond domenech , missing playmaker zinedine zidane and defender eric abidal through suspension , paired david trezeguet with thierry henry in attack for a game the french must win by two clear goals to make sure of reaching the last 16 of the world cup .

mikael silvestre comes in for abidal at left back while central defender lilian thuram wins his 117th cap , breaking the national record he shared with marcel desailly .

the players are in the tunnel .
the teams take the pitch .
the crowd roars a welcome that quickly changes into peace as the anthems begin .
a long strip of yellow togo fans run along the side of the field but the blue fans of france are in majority under the roof in cologne .
1. min .
the french kick-off .
1. min .
the french will certainly try to get an early goal .
they start off in a good tempo and sagnol gets the first cross .
3. min .
the french are high up .
first chance is trzeguet 's .
the striker gets the ball just inside the box and turns to shoot .
his ball goes a meter wide .
5. min .
the french will have to watch out though .

6. min .
trzeguet again .
ribery hits in the cross from the left and trezeguet heads it hard .
agassa gets a hand on it and tips it over the bar .
8. min .
a fast counter attack by togo gives barthez in the french goal a first opportunity to show himself .
10. min .
the game is leveling out .
the first minutes of french dominance have given way to a more even game .
11. min .
a long cross from the right ends up only a meter away from barthez who saves the following shot standing on his knees .
13. min .
trezeguet 's goal is offside .
the french striker gets the ball from ribery inside the box and scores before realizing he 's offside .
17. min .
the french have had a couple of good chances to score but so far it 's goalless .
the togolese are dangerous though when they get a chance to counter , something they do at high speed .
19. min .
the togolese have had it fairly easy to break the french attack , which gives the africans possibilities to counter over and over again .
21. min .
trezeguet again .
ribery has started the match well and hits another opener for trezeguet who should have finished better .
the ball is no problem for agassa .
22. min .
silvestre tries agassa with a half volley .
the pressure is there , the chances too but no goal .
25. min .
mamam tries a cross towards the middle but there are no togolese there .
27. min .
salifou comes in from the left and fires a shot that barthez ca n't hold at first .
the french goalie jumps forward to pull the ball back in .
27. min .
ribery brings the ball down the togolese field and gets a great chance to score .
his shot flies high over the goal though .
28. min .
makelele gets booked .
29. min .
mamam 's free-kick outside the french box is too high .
31. min .
a ball from ribery sails in to the box and is headed over the end line by nibombe just before trezeguet gets a chance to put his head on the ball .
35. min .
trezeguet gets a ball to run for but again the french striker is caught offside .
this time it 's very close .
37. min .
aziawonou sees yellow .
38. min .
the french keep coming in strong attacking waves but the togolese have so far always found a way to surf their way out of trouble .
39. min .
henry fires a rocket from thirty meters .
agassa can not hold it .
trezeguet takes the rebound from five meters but the togolese keeper is there again .
40. min .
will the french go into a panic ?
a first false pass by the french is met with whistles .
the french crowd is merciless .
43. min .
mamam gets booked .
the togolese holds on to vieira in the mid circle .
45. min .
the togolese must be happy going into the break with a 0-0 .
45 + 1. min .
a lovely cross from malouda is headed out by nibombe who 's perfectly placed in front of trezeguet and henry both waiting to score .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the french have piled up chances but no goal .
the togolese will have a tough second half but are also pretty cool in defense and make use of their counters , which have given the africans a handful of decent chances .
as it stands , a 0-1 for the french will be enough to see them trough thanks to the swiss leading korea 1-0 .
question is if france will have the mental strength to deliver .
45. min .
second half is on .
45. min .
let 's see if ribery can keep up his good work .
the french midfielder has shown there is life after zidane .
47. min .
ribery wins a free-kick deep on the right outside the box .
47. min .
ribery hits it towards the box line where a waiting trezeguet fires away .
the ball rebounds on a togolese to a corner .
49. min .
adebayor is free with barthez after a lovely chip .
the togolese is wrongly caught offside .
50. min .
kader fights his way towards the french box and gets a shot that flies high .
52. min .
beautiful combination by the french .
henry goes into the box and heels the ball to malouda who drives a cross into the middle where ribery has a great possibility to score but he shoots it up to the stands .
54. min .
goal france ! ! !
vieria .
54. min .
ribery brings the ball in on the left side of the box and passes it along the grass to vieira in the middle who turns and shoots the ball into the right side of the goal .
57. min .
henry gets the next chance as a high cross ball reaches his foot just in front of the togolese goal .
the ball goes wide .
58. min .
mamam goes for olufade .
the togolese bring on a striker for a midfielder .
60. min .
goal !
france !
henry ! ! ! 60. min .
sagnol hits the cross to the box line where vieira heads it on to a free standing henry .
this time nothing can stop him from hitting home his 35th goal for france .
63. min .
the french know they are through with this result but it looks like they will try to score another to be sure .
65. min .
the togolese play much the same way as in first half , waiting for the break to counter attack .
in second half though it has n't resulted in much .
66. min .
sagnol hits a ball along the right wing for ribery who gets the cross in but it goes past all players in the togolese box .
67. min .
vieira finds time for a delicious slide rule pass that reaches trezeguet but agassa is first on the ball .
70. min .
the togolese pay a rare visit to the french box .
the africans have little to play for and it 's understandable that their motivation might not be the strongest .
71. min .
the french are cutting down on the tempo .
73. min .
wiltord goes on for malouda .
an offensive substitution by the french coach suggests he wants more .
74. min .
adebayor leaves for dossevi .
77. min .
ribery leaves the pitch for govou .
ribery can be pleased with his performance .
78. min .
vieira is down after an accidental slap in the face .
the frenchman might be fishing for time a bit as the crowd does the wave .
80. min .
vieira walks off for diarra .
vieira has been the most prolific of the french in the second half .
82. min .
govou wins a free-kick on the right .
the french are not in hurry .
83. min .
another french free-kick sees diarra down for a while before he stands up again .
85. min .
a long ball into the french box forces barthez to make a short rush to be first on the ball .
87. min .
salifou sees yellow .
the togolese is not happy about the decision .
89. min .
togo get a last chance to score but they are a bit too slow inside the box to get a finish on the french goal .
90 + 1. min .
the togolese break in the circle and get yet another chance but no , the finishing touch is not there .
45 + 2. min .
the match is over .
france have won .
the last group stage games of the 2006 world cup have been played and the result is switzerland on top of group g which means they play ukraine , wheras france , group runners up , will have to play spain - which could be one of the more interesting last sixteen games . dw staff -lrb- per -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

live ticker : togo 0:2 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 23.06.2006 live ticker : togo 0:2 france review all the highlights from the game with the dw-world.de live ticker . group g final games dw-world.de will follow already out togo against a france who will have to take their last chance to show they are still a team to count on and not just a set of individual quality .
the french must win to go through while switzerland and south-korea could reach the last sixteen with a draw , although it 's unlikely any of the teams will want to risk playing for such a result .
the line-ups .
togo -lrb- 3-5-2 -rrb- : 16-kossi agassa ; 2-dare nibombe , 3-jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , 5-massamesso tchangai ; 13-richmond forson , 7-moustapha salifou , 18-yao junior senaya , 10-cherif toure mamam , 6-yao aziawanou ; 4-emmanuel adebayor , 17-mohamed kader coubadja .
coach : otto pfister france -lrb- 4-4-2 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 13-mikael silvestre ; 22-franck ribery , 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele , 7-florent malouda ; 20-david trezeguet , 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- france coach raymond domenech , missing playmaker zinedine zidane and defender eric abidal through suspension , paired david trezeguet with thierry henry in attack for a game the french must win by two clear goals to make sure of reaching the last 16 of the world cup .
there is no genuine playmaker to replace zidane in a four-man midfield on the right side of which exciting newcomer franck ribery will start a match for france for the second time .
mikael silvestre comes in for abidal at left back while central defender lilian thuram wins his 117th cap , breaking the national record he shared with marcel desailly .
togo coach otto pfister , who had promised to gave all of his players a chance to take the field , made four changes to his starting line-up bringing in jean paul yaovi abalo dosseh , yao aziawanou , moustapha salifou and yao junior senaya , in place of thomas dossevi , kuami agboh , alaixys romao and toure assimiou .
the players are in the tunnel .
the teams take the pitch .
the crowd roars a welcome that quickly changes into peace as the anthems begin .
a long strip of yellow togo fans run along the side of the field but the blue fans of france are in majority under the roof in cologne .
1. min .
the french kick-off .
1. min .
the french will certainly try to get an early goal .
they start off in a good tempo and sagnol gets the first cross .
3. min .
the french are high up .
first chance is trzeguet 's .
the striker gets the ball just inside the box and turns to shoot .
his ball goes a meter wide .
5. min .
the french will have to watch out though .
it is never easy to play a team who has nothing to lose .
6. min .
trzeguet again .
ribery hits in the cross from the left and trezeguet heads it hard .
agassa gets a hand on it and tips it over the bar .
8. min .
a fast counter attack by togo gives barthez in the french goal a first opportunity to show himself .
10. min .
the game is leveling out .
the first minutes of french dominance have given way to a more even game .
11. min .
a long cross from the right ends up only a meter away from barthez who saves the following shot standing on his knees .
13. min .
trezeguet 's goal is offside .
the french striker gets the ball from ribery inside the box and scores before realizing he 's offside .
17. min .
the french have had a couple of good chances to score but so far it 's goalless .
the togolese are dangerous though when they get a chance to counter , something they do at high speed .
19. min .
the togolese have had it fairly easy to break the french attack , which gives the africans possibilities to counter over and over again .
21. min .
trezeguet again .
ribery has started the match well and hits another opener for trezeguet who should have finished better .
the ball is no problem for agassa .
22. min .
silvestre tries agassa with a half volley .
the pressure is there , the chances too but no goal .
25. min .
mamam tries a cross towards the middle but there are no togolese there .
27. min .
salifou comes in from the left and fires a shot that barthez ca n't hold at first .
the french goalie jumps forward to pull the ball back in .
27. min .
ribery brings the ball down the togolese field and gets a great chance to score .
his shot flies high over the goal though .
28. min .
makelele gets booked .
29. min .
mamam 's free-kick outside the french box is too high .
31. min .
a ball from ribery sails in to the box and is headed over the end line by nibombe just before trezeguet gets a chance to put his head on the ball .
35. min .
trezeguet gets a ball to run for but again the french striker is caught offside .
this time it 's very close .
37. min .
aziawonou sees yellow .
38. min .
the french keep coming in strong attacking waves but the togolese have so far always found a way to surf their way out of trouble .
39. min .
henry fires a rocket from thirty meters .
agassa can not hold it .
trezeguet takes the rebound from five meters but the togolese keeper is there again .
40. min .
will the french go into a panic ?
a first false pass by the french is met with whistles .
the french crowd is merciless .
43. min .
mamam gets booked .
the togolese holds on to vieira in the mid circle .
45. min .
the togolese must be happy going into the break with a 0-0 .
45 + 1. min .
a lovely cross from malouda is headed out by nibombe who 's perfectly placed in front of trezeguet and henry both waiting to score .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the french have piled up chances but no goal .
the togolese will have a tough second half but are also pretty cool in defense and make use of their counters , which have given the africans a handful of decent chances .
as it stands , a 0-1 for the french will be enough to see them trough thanks to the swiss leading korea 1-0 .
question is if france will have the mental strength to deliver .
45. min .
second half is on .
45. min .
let 's see if ribery can keep up his good work .
the french midfielder has shown there is life after zidane .
47. min .
ribery wins a free-kick deep on the right outside the box .
47. min .
ribery hits it towards the box line where a waiting trezeguet fires away .
the ball rebounds on a togolese to a corner .
49. min .
adebayor is free with barthez after a lovely chip .
the togolese is wrongly caught offside .
50. min .
kader fights his way towards the french box and gets a shot that flies high .
52. min .
beautiful combination by the french .
henry goes into the box and heels the ball to malouda who drives a cross into the middle where ribery has a great possibility to score but he shoots it up to the stands .
54. min .
goal france ! ! !
vieria .
54. min .
ribery brings the ball in on the left side of the box and passes it along the grass to vieira in the middle who turns and shoots the ball into the right side of the goal .
57. min .
henry gets the next chance as a high cross ball reaches his foot just in front of the togolese goal .
the ball goes wide .
58. min .
mamam goes for olufade .
the togolese bring on a striker for a midfielder .
60. min .
goal !
france !
henry ! ! ! 60. min .
sagnol hits the cross to the box line where vieira heads it on to a free standing henry .
this time nothing can stop him from hitting home his 35th goal for france .

the french know they are through with this result but it looks like they will try to score another to be sure .
65. min .
the togolese play much the same way as in first half , waiting for the break to counter attack .
in second half though it has n't resulted in much .
66. min .
sagnol hits a ball along the right wing for ribery who gets the cross in but it goes past all players in the togolese box .
67. min .
vieira finds time for a delicious slide rule pass that reaches trezeguet but agassa is first on the ball .
70. min .
the togolese pay a rare visit to the french box .
the africans have little to play for and it 's understandable that their motivation might not be the strongest .

73. min .
wiltord goes on for malouda .

74. min .

the frenchman might be fishing for time a bit as the crowd does the wave .

vieira has been the most prolific of the french in the second half .

83. min .

87. min .
salifou sees yellow .
the togolese is not happy about the decision .

france have won .

vieria .
54. min .
ribery brings the ball in on the left side of the box and passes it along the grass to vieira in the middle who turns and shoots the ball into the right side of the goal .
57. min .
henry gets the next chance as a high cross ball reaches his foot just in front of the togolese goal .
the ball goes wide .
58. min .
mamam goes for olufade .
the togolese bring on a striker for a midfielder .
60. min .
goal !
france !
henry ! ! ! 60. min .
sagnol hits the cross to the box line where vieira heads it on to a free standing henry .
this time nothing can stop him from hitting home his 35th goal for france .
63. min .
the french know they are through with this result but it looks like they will try to score another to be sure .
65. min .
the togolese play much the same way as in first half , waiting for the break to counter attack .
in second half though it has n't resulted in much .
66. min .
sagnol hits a ball along the right wing for ribery who gets the cross in but it goes past all players in the togolese box .
67. min .
vieira finds time for a delicious slide rule pass that reaches trezeguet but agassa is first on the ball .
70. min .
the togolese pay a rare visit to the french box .
the africans have little to play for and it 's understandable that their motivation might not be the strongest .
71. min .
the french are cutting down on the tempo .
73. min .
wiltord goes on for malouda .
an offensive substitution by the french coach suggests he wants more .
74. min .
adebayor leaves for dossevi .
77. min .
ribery leaves the pitch for govou .
ribery can be pleased with his performance .
78. min .
vieira is down after an accidental slap in the face .
the frenchman might be fishing for time a bit as the crowd does the wave .
80. min .
vieira walks off for diarra .
vieira has been the most prolific of the french in the second half .
82. min .
govou wins a free-kick on the right .
the french are not in hurry .
83. min .
another french free-kick sees diarra down for a while before he stands up again .
85. min .
a long ball into the french box forces barthez to make a short rush to be first on the ball .
87. min .
salifou sees yellow .
the togolese is not happy about the decision .
89. min .
togo get a last chance to score but they are a bit too slow inside the box to get a finish on the french goal .
90 + 1. min .
the togolese break in the circle and get yet another chance but no , the finishing touch is not there .
45 + 2. min .
the match is over .
france have won .
the last group stage games of the 2006 world cup have been played and the result is switzerland on top of group g which means they play ukraine , wheras france , group runners up , will have to play spain - which could be one of the more interesting last sixteen games . dw staff -lrb- per -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 30.03.2011 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 23.06.2006 opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush delivered his speech on budapest 's gellert hill with his speech in budapest on thursday , us president george w. bush attempted to latch onto an american tradition of great orations on freedom , but it did n't quite work out that way , says dw 's miodrag soric . john f. kennedy , jimmy carter , ronald reagan : all of these american presidents delivered speeches in europe on the topic of freedom .
above all , they called on the soviet dictators to give freedom back to the nations of eastern europe .
the support of the free world was guaranteed , as was resounding applause back home .
on thursday , president bush attempted to follow this tradition with a speech in budapest , but he did n't quite succeed .
the most important difference since the era of reagan and his predecessors : the soviet union .
the country once dubbed the " evil empire " no longer exists .
even if critics still rightly point to the kremlin 's human rights violations , the fact is that even russia is on the path towards becoming a democracy . shaky comparison the other point is that calls for freedom are much more effective when the speaker draws on the present-day situation .
president bush , however , drew on hungary 's unsuccessful 1956 revolt against communism .
he tried to segue to the here and now with a comment on iraq , the message being : just as hungarians fought for freedom in 1956 , so iraqis do today . but this comparison , as with so many historical comparisons , flopped .
it does n't even bear thinking about what would happen if the iraqis really were in a position to decide whether american troops were welcome in their country or not . in the arab world , many compare the soviet occupation of afghanistan in 1979 with the deployment of american troops in iraq today .
bush would , rightly so , reject such parallels .
without the presence of us troops , iraq would likely slide into a state of civil war .
and even though this is the case , bush was still unable to portray us troops as liberators in his speech . lacking credibility bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : amnesty international activists dressed as guantanamo detainees for their protest in budapest this is mainly due to the policies of the united states and its highest officials .
those who - like bush - lay claim to a leading role in the fight for freedom and respect for human rights should at least be credible .
the americans simply do n't have the kind of credibility they did back in 1956 . in recent times , american soldiers have too often been guilty of human rights violations , killing and torturing civilians .
you ca n't claim to respect human rights and defend a camp like guantanamo in the same breath .
september 11 , 2001 can not eternally be used as an excuse as to why international laws should apply to all nations except the usa . if anyone in budapest deserves to be praised , then it 's hungarian president laszlo solyom , whose message to bush was that the fight against international terrorism can only succeed if , at every step , the rules of international justice are obeyed and human rights are respected . miodrag soric -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo us president george w. bush and eu leaders wednesday sent a warning to iran and north korea on their nuclear plans but avoided a public squabble over eu concerns at human rights abuses in guantanamo bay prison camp .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu , us present united front ahead of vienna summit vienna is gearing up to host the next eu-us summit on wednesday .
while the relationship between the two powers is often described as " complex , " this time , it seems there is consensus on the main issues up for discussion .
-lrb- june 20 , 2006 -rrb- feedback how do you think bush performed in budapest ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 18.09.2010 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 23.06.2006 opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush delivered his speech on budapest 's gellert hill with his speech in budapest on thursday , us president george w. bush attempted to latch onto an american tradition of great orations on freedom , but it did n't quite work out that way , says dw 's miodrag soric . john f. kennedy , jimmy carter , ronald reagan : all of these american presidents delivered speeches in europe on the topic of freedom .
above all , they called on the soviet dictators to give freedom back to the nations of eastern europe .
the support of the free world was guaranteed , as was resounding applause back home .
on thursday , president bush attempted to follow this tradition with a speech in budapest , but he did n't quite succeed .
the most important difference since the era of reagan and his predecessors : the soviet union .
the country once dubbed the " evil empire " no longer exists .
even if critics still rightly point to the kremlin 's human rights violations , the fact is that even russia is on the path towards becoming a democracy . shaky comparison the other point is that calls for freedom are much more effective when the speaker draws on the present-day situation .
president bush , however , drew on hungary 's unsuccessful 1956 revolt against communism .
he tried to segue to the here and now with a comment on iraq , the message being : just as hungarians fought for freedom in 1956 , so iraqis do today . but this comparison , as with so many historical comparisons , flopped .
it does n't even bear thinking about what would happen if the iraqis really were in a position to decide whether american troops were welcome in their country or not . in the arab world , many compare the soviet occupation of afghanistan in 1979 with the deployment of american troops in iraq today .
bush would , rightly so , reject such parallels .
without the presence of us troops , iraq would likely slide into a state of civil war .
and even though this is the case , bush was still unable to portray us troops as liberators in his speech . lacking credibility bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : amnesty international activists dressed as guantanamo detainees for their protest in budapest this is mainly due to the policies of the united states and its highest officials .
those who - like bush - lay claim to a leading role in the fight for freedom and respect for human rights should at least be credible .
the americans simply do n't have the kind of credibility they did back in 1956 . in recent times , american soldiers have too often been guilty of human rights violations , killing and torturing civilians .
you ca n't claim to respect human rights and defend a camp like guantanamo in the same breath .
september 11 , 2001 can not eternally be used as an excuse as to why international laws should apply to all nations except the usa . if anyone in budapest deserves to be praised , then it 's hungarian president laszlo solyom , whose message to bush was that the fight against international terrorism can only succeed if , at every step , the rules of international justice are obeyed and human rights are respected . miodrag soric -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo us president george w. bush and eu leaders wednesday sent a warning to iran and north korea on their nuclear plans but avoided a public squabble over eu concerns at human rights abuses in guantanamo bay prison camp .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu , us present united front ahead of vienna summit vienna is gearing up to host the next eu-us summit on wednesday .
while the relationship between the two powers is often described as " complex , " this time , it seems there is consensus on the main issues up for discussion .

opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 15.01.2011 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 23.06.2006 opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush delivered his speech on budapest 's gellert hill with his speech in budapest on thursday , us president george w. bush attempted to latch onto an american tradition of great orations on freedom , but it did n't quite work out that way , says dw 's miodrag soric . john f. kennedy , jimmy carter , ronald reagan : all of these american presidents delivered speeches in europe on the topic of freedom .
above all , they called on the soviet dictators to give freedom back to the nations of eastern europe .
the support of the free world was guaranteed , as was resounding applause back home .
on thursday , president bush attempted to follow this tradition with a speech in budapest , but he did n't quite succeed .
the most important difference since the era of reagan and his predecessors : the soviet union .
the country once dubbed the " evil empire " no longer exists .
even if critics still rightly point to the kremlin 's human rights violations , the fact is that even russia is on the path towards becoming a democracy . shaky comparison the other point is that calls for freedom are much more effective when the speaker draws on the present-day situation .
president bush , however , drew on hungary 's unsuccessful 1956 revolt against communism .
he tried to segue to the here and now with a comment on iraq , the message being : just as hungarians fought for freedom in 1956 , so iraqis do today . but this comparison , as with so many historical comparisons , flopped .
it does n't even bear thinking about what would happen if the iraqis really were in a position to decide whether american troops were welcome in their country or not . in the arab world , many compare the soviet occupation of afghanistan in 1979 with the deployment of american troops in iraq today .
bush would , rightly so , reject such parallels .
without the presence of us troops , iraq would likely slide into a state of civil war .
and even though this is the case , bush was still unable to portray us troops as liberators in his speech . lacking credibility bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : amnesty international activists dressed as guantanamo detainees for their protest in budapest this is mainly due to the policies of the united states and its highest officials .
those who - like bush - lay claim to a leading role in the fight for freedom and respect for human rights should at least be credible .
the americans simply do n't have the kind of credibility they did back in 1956 . in recent times , american soldiers have too often been guilty of human rights violations , killing and torturing civilians .
you ca n't claim to respect human rights and defend a camp like guantanamo in the same breath .
september 11 , 2001 can not eternally be used as an excuse as to why international laws should apply to all nations except the usa . if anyone in budapest deserves to be praised , then it 's hungarian president laszlo solyom , whose message to bush was that the fight against international terrorism can only succeed if , at every step , the rules of international justice are obeyed and human rights are respected . miodrag soric -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo us president george w. bush and eu leaders wednesday sent a warning to iran and north korea on their nuclear plans but avoided a public squabble over eu concerns at human rights abuses in guantanamo bay prison camp .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu , us present united front ahead of vienna summit vienna is gearing up to host the next eu-us summit on wednesday .
while the relationship between the two powers is often described as " complex , " this time , it seems there is consensus on the main issues up for discussion .
-lrb- june 20 , 2006 -rrb- feedback how do you think bush performed in budapest ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

italians hard hit by plastic bag ban east meets west in russia for christmas a little headache called austria uk prisoners to get the vote the demise of an oracle europe keep up with the latest in europe .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 23.06.2006 opinion : bush 's freedom speech fell flat großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush delivered his speech on budapest 's gellert hill with his speech in budapest on thursday , us president george w. bush attempted to latch onto an american tradition of great orations on freedom , but it did n't quite work out that way , says dw 's miodrag soric . john f. kennedy , jimmy carter , ronald reagan : all of these american presidents delivered speeches in europe on the topic of freedom .

the country once dubbed the " evil empire " no longer exists .

bush would , rightly so , reject such parallels .
without the presence of us troops , iraq would likely slide into a state of civil war .
and even though this is the case , bush was still unable to portray us troops as liberators in his speech . lacking credibility bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : amnesty international activists dressed as guantanamo detainees for their protest in budapest this is mainly due to the policies of the united states and its highest officials .
those who - like bush - lay claim to a leading role in the fight for freedom and respect for human rights should at least be credible .

-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu , us present united front ahead of vienna summit vienna is gearing up to host the next eu-us summit on wednesday .

german authorities deny knowledge of el-masri interrogator -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 29.03.2011 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 23.06.2006 german authorities deny knowledge of el-masri interrogator großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : khaled el-masri stands by his story a parliamentary committee looking into the role of german intelligence during the iraq war was told there was no proof of collusion by german authorities in the abduction of a man who says he was kidnapped by the cia . khaled el-masri , the lebanese-born man at the center of the probe , gave the panel his account of what happened to him nearly three years ago .
a naturalized german citizen , he insisted he was interrogated by a german agent . " based on the way he looked and his accent , he was definitely german , " he said .
he explained that the man he knew as " sam " made his first appearance in the kabul prison where el-masri was being held in may 2004 , and that his treatment improved immediately . el-masri said he had recognized " sam " in photographs of an official with the federal criminal police office -lrb- bka -rrb- . nonetheless , according to martin hofmann , one of the state prosecutors investigating the case , " there is no evidence to suggest that el-masri 's account of his abduction is not accurate . " but both german intelligence and the bka have denied that " sam " works for either body and said they could prove that the man identified by el-masri was in germany at the time of his abduction . does germany sanction torture ? while one burning question at thursday 's hearing was the identity of " sam , " another was the extent of german authorities ' involvement in the case . wolfgang neskovic , the left party 's member of the oversight committee , said that the basic principle at stake was whether germany was willing to sanction torture as a tool in the war on terror . so far , the committee 's findings have been neutral . " there 's still no proof that german authorities were involved in the incident , " said thomas opermann from the investigation committee . injustice bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : el-masri broke down during the hearing but el-masri 's attorney has argued otherwise . " if it turns out that german authorities were involved , then it would n't be up to us to demand action .
what happened was a huge injustice , " said his lawyer , manfred gnjidic . el-masri says he was kidnapped while in macedonia in late 2003 and then transferred to a cia-run prison in afghanistan where he was held for four months .
after his release he says he was dumped in albania . recalling his ordeal , el-masri struggled to contain himself and asked for a break in questioning . opposition mps are outraged by his account . " he was kidnapped , and interrogated under horrible conditions in afghanistan after being questioned in macedonia , " said hans-christian ströbele from the green party . the inquiry is scheduled to meet again next thursday to continue looking into el-masri 's allegations . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de german testifies in probe into alleged cia abduction a parliamentary probe hears testimony from a german citizen , khaled al-masri , who alleged he was kidnapped by the cia and held for five months in an afghan jail .
german authorities have denied a role in the affair .
-lrb- june 22 , 2006 -rrb- german intelligence agency admits knowledge of cia abduction following a disclosure that the german intelligence spied on german journalists , the agency is admitting another embarrassing mistake - that it knew of the abduction of a german national almost two years ago .
-lrb- june 1 , 2006 -rrb- commission scrutinizes german intelligence 's role in iraq a german parliamentary commission is meeting wednesday behind closed doors to examine the role of the country 's secret service in the iraq war .
-lrb- feb .
22 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic el masri appears before the investigation committee feedback do you find el-masri 's evidence credible ?
send us an e-mail , and please include your name and country in your reply .

german authorities deny knowledge of el-masri interrogator -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 23.06.2006 german authorities deny knowledge of el-masri interrogator großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : khaled el-masri stands by his story a parliamentary committee looking into the role of german intelligence during the iraq war was told there was no proof of collusion by german authorities in the abduction of a man who says he was kidnapped by the cia . khaled el-masri , the lebanese-born man at the center of the probe , gave the panel his account of what happened to him nearly three years ago .
a naturalized german citizen , he insisted he was interrogated by a german agent . " based on the way he looked and his accent , he was definitely german , " he said .
he explained that the man he knew as " sam " made his first appearance in the kabul prison where el-masri was being held in may 2004 , and that his treatment improved immediately . el-masri said he had recognized " sam " in photographs of an official with the federal criminal police office -lrb- bka -rrb- . nonetheless , according to martin hofmann , one of the state prosecutors investigating the case , " there is no evidence to suggest that el-masri 's account of his abduction is not accurate . " but both german intelligence and the bka have denied that " sam " works for either body and said they could prove that the man identified by el-masri was in germany at the time of his abduction . does germany sanction torture ? while one burning question at thursday 's hearing was the identity of " sam , " another was the extent of german authorities ' involvement in the case . wolfgang neskovic , the left party 's member of the oversight committee , said that the basic principle at stake was whether germany was willing to sanction torture as a tool in the war on terror . so far , the committee 's findings have been neutral . " there 's still no proof that german authorities were involved in the incident , " said thomas opermann from the investigation committee . injustice bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : el-masri broke down during the hearing but el-masri 's attorney has argued otherwise . " if it turns out that german authorities were involved , then it would n't be up to us to demand action .
what happened was a huge injustice , " said his lawyer , manfred gnjidic . el-masri says he was kidnapped while in macedonia in late 2003 and then transferred to a cia-run prison in afghanistan where he was held for four months .
after his release he says he was dumped in albania . recalling his ordeal , el-masri struggled to contain himself and asked for a break in questioning . opposition mps are outraged by his account . " he was kidnapped , and interrogated under horrible conditions in afghanistan after being questioned in macedonia , " said hans-christian ströbele from the green party . the inquiry is scheduled to meet again next thursday to continue looking into el-masri 's allegations . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de german testifies in probe into alleged cia abduction a parliamentary probe hears testimony from a german citizen , khaled al-masri , who alleged he was kidnapped by the cia and held for five months in an afghan jail .
german authorities have denied a role in the affair .
-lrb- june 22 , 2006 -rrb- german intelligence agency admits knowledge of cia abduction following a disclosure that the german intelligence spied on german journalists , the agency is admitting another embarrassing mistake - that it knew of the abduction of a german national almost two years ago .
-lrb- june 1 , 2006 -rrb- commission scrutinizes german intelligence 's role in iraq a german parliamentary commission is meeting wednesday behind closed doors to examine the role of the country 's secret service in the iraq war .
-lrb- feb .
22 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic el masri appears before the investigation committee feedback do you find el-masri 's evidence credible ?

travel passau is called the three river city , but it is just as famous for its baroque splendor .

german authorities deny knowledge of el-masri interrogator -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 23.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 14.01.2011 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 23.06.2006 german authorities deny knowledge of el-masri interrogator großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : khaled el-masri stands by his story a parliamentary committee looking into the role of german intelligence during the iraq war was told there was no proof of collusion by german authorities in the abduction of a man who says he was kidnapped by the cia . khaled el-masri , the lebanese-born man at the center of the probe , gave the panel his account of what happened to him nearly three years ago .
a naturalized german citizen , he insisted he was interrogated by a german agent . " based on the way he looked and his accent , he was definitely german , " he said .
he explained that the man he knew as " sam " made his first appearance in the kabul prison where el-masri was being held in may 2004 , and that his treatment improved immediately . el-masri said he had recognized " sam " in photographs of an official with the federal criminal police office -lrb- bka -rrb- . nonetheless , according to martin hofmann , one of the state prosecutors investigating the case , " there is no evidence to suggest that el-masri 's account of his abduction is not accurate . " but both german intelligence and the bka have denied that " sam " works for either body and said they could prove that the man identified by el-masri was in germany at the time of his abduction . does germany sanction torture ? while one burning question at thursday 's hearing was the identity of " sam , " another was the extent of german authorities ' involvement in the case . wolfgang neskovic , the left party 's member of the oversight committee , said that the basic principle at stake was whether germany was willing to sanction torture as a tool in the war on terror . so far , the committee 's findings have been neutral . " there 's still no proof that german authorities were involved in the incident , " said thomas opermann from the investigation committee . injustice bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : el-masri broke down during the hearing but el-masri 's attorney has argued otherwise . " if it turns out that german authorities were involved , then it would n't be up to us to demand action .
what happened was a huge injustice , " said his lawyer , manfred gnjidic . el-masri says he was kidnapped while in macedonia in late 2003 and then transferred to a cia-run prison in afghanistan where he was held for four months .
after his release he says he was dumped in albania . recalling his ordeal , el-masri struggled to contain himself and asked for a break in questioning . opposition mps are outraged by his account . " he was kidnapped , and interrogated under horrible conditions in afghanistan after being questioned in macedonia , " said hans-christian ströbele from the green party . the inquiry is scheduled to meet again next thursday to continue looking into el-masri 's allegations . dw staff -lrb- jp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de german testifies in probe into alleged cia abduction a parliamentary probe hears testimony from a german citizen , khaled al-masri , who alleged he was kidnapped by the cia and held for five months in an afghan jail .
german authorities have denied a role in the affair .
-lrb- june 22 , 2006 -rrb- german intelligence agency admits knowledge of cia abduction following a disclosure that the german intelligence spied on german journalists , the agency is admitting another embarrassing mistake - that it knew of the abduction of a german national almost two years ago .
-lrb- june 1 , 2006 -rrb- commission scrutinizes german intelligence 's role in iraq a german parliamentary commission is meeting wednesday behind closed doors to examine the role of the country 's secret service in the iraq war .
-lrb- feb .
22 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic el masri appears before the investigation committee feedback do you find el-masri 's evidence credible ?
send us an e-mail , and please include your name and country in your reply .
